ResearchProjectDef.label: Wraith science
ResearchProjectDef.description: Begin unlocking the secrets of Wraith bio-engineering—where everything is grown, pulsing, and slightly slimy.\nWarning: side effects may include telepathy and power hunger.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Wraith armor
ResearchProjectDef.description: Research armor grown from bio-organic materials tailored to Wraith physiology. Flexible, durable, and mildly unsettling to the touch.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Force buckler
ResearchProjectDef.description: Reverse-engineer a wrist-mounted Wraith repulsor field. Study captured shield matrices and mesh them with human shield-belt theory to fabricate compact bucklers that block both melee and gunfire. Caution: when the field collapses, the bearer is exposed—train your melee to strike while the glow still holds.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Wraith weapons
ResearchProjectDef.description: Reverse-engineer Wraith energy weapons—organic-looking tools of destruction designed for elegant disintegration and maximum dread.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Wraith hacking
ResearchProjectDef.description: Reverse-engineer Wraith neural interface tech to bend machines to your will. Great for remote control, terrible for privacy.

rulesStrings.li: subject->Wraith neural interface
subject_story->extracted a faint signal pulse from a dormant Wraith comm node
subject_story->spliced human tech into a decomposing Wraith device and it blinked at me
subject_story->picked up encrypted chatter between hibernating hive nodes
subject_story->accidentally connected to a Wraith drone's memory stream... and now I can't unsee it
subject_gerund->tapping into Wraith communication tech

ResearchProjectDef.label: Gate Modification
ResearchProjectDef.description: Adaptations of Wraith neural interface rigs and sensory dampening gear.\n\nWith this knowledge, your scientists can alter Dwarfgate control systems to block long-range subspace "backscatter," preventing unauthorized remote peeks into connected sites. Only after this research can your colony safely observe both ends of an active wormhole.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Meat cultivation
ResearchProjectDef.description: Learn to bio-cultivate fresh, nutritious meat without hunting, farming, or asking permission from your livestock.\nA breakthrough in sustainable horror.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Cloning
ResearchProjectDef.description: Unlock Wraith genome templating: growth protocols, enzyme baths, and neural imprint scaffolds that skip childhood entirely.\n\nFresh bodies on demand—morals sold separately. Expect epigenetic drift, occasional extra teeth, and complaints from HR.
ResearchProjectDef.discoveredLetterText:
Your team has decoded Wraith growth-cycle notations: biomass liquefaction, lattice seeding, and accelerated maturation inside pressurized biotanks.

It works disturbingly well. Results exhibit minor personality artifacts and a strong opinion about lighting.

Proceed if you’re comfortable printing people.

rulesStrings.li: subject->Wraith cloning pod
subject->genome slurry
subject->neural imprint scaffold
subject_story->a glass lung that breathes new soldiers into being
subject_story->a whispering vat that remembers hunger
subject_story->a growth cycle timed by the rhythm of pumps and prayers
subject_gerund->stitching genomes into self-assembling tissue
subject_gerund->bathing biomass in enzymatic accelerants
subject_gerund->pinning memories to fresh synapses before they harden

ResearchProjectDef.label: Full-body replication
ResearchProjectDef.description: Enable full-body replication for any pawn—Wraith, human, or unlucky intern.\n\nCopies quirks, scars, and bedtime fears with alarming fidelity. Printing colonists is now a workflow.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Clone enhancement
ResearchProjectDef.description: Optimize the slurry: stronger bones, faster reflexes, cleaner neural binds.\n\nSide effects may include telepathy, hissing, and a belief that hallways should be darker.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Reconstruction
ResearchProjectDef.description: Reconstruction protocols extend cloning into reclamation: if you have biomass and a template, death becomes a scheduling error.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Biomass generator
ResearchProjectDef.description: Unlock the Wraith biomass generator—an advanced power source fueled by cultivated organic matter processed into biomass.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Wraith Dart
ResearchProjectDef.description:
Gain access to the Wraith Dart: a biomechanical interceptor that blends flesh, alloy, and arrogance.

Fast enough to outfly missiles, light enough to panic your pilot, and just roomy enough to abduct someone who disagreed with you.

Fuel efficiency is theoretical; terror efficiency is unmatched.
ResearchProjectDef.discoveredLetterText:
The Wraith Dart’s structure isn’t built—it’s grown. Its hull is a living capacitor tuned to pulse drives and stasis cells.

Reverse-engineering it means learning to trick life itself into wanting to fly.

We probably shouldn’t—but we will anyway.

rulesStrings.li: subject->Wraith Dart
subject->bio-organic interceptor
subject->hunter craft
subject_story->a shrieking silhouette that melts into the clouds
subject_story->a cockpit that hums like a heartbeat
subject_story->a hull that heals from bullet holes like closing wounds
subject_gerund->decoding neural flight control patterns
subject_gerund->synthesizing biopolymer hull tissues under vacuum
subject_gerund->splicing Wraith protein matrices into human-grade fuel cells

ResearchProjectDef.label: Advanced bioengineering
ResearchProjectDef.description: Optimize the meat cultivation process by applying advanced bioengineering techniques to increase the power yield of biomass generators and reduce resource consumption of meat labs.
ResearchProjectDef.discoveredLetterText: Advanced bioengineering techniques have been applied to optimize the meat cultivation process by increasing the power yield of biomass generators and reducing resource consumption of meat labs.

ResearchProjectDef.label: cloning pod optimization
ResearchProjectDef.description:
Apply ZPM-inspired power-shaping techniques to Wraith biotank architecture. By synchronizing pump rhythms, enzyme heaters, and neural-imprint grids to stable subspace harmonics, your engineers can dramatically smooth the cloning pod’s energy demands.

These insights also reveal a broader truth: the pod’s inefficiencies are not purely energetic, but cyclical. With proper harmonic control, biomass can be conditioned instead of wasted, and growth cycles can be entrained rather than brute-forced.

The result is a quieter, more efficient cloning system—supported by auxiliary bio-devices that stabilize nutrient flow and accelerate incubation through controlled resonance.

It won’t make the pod any less unsettling.

But it will make it smarter.

rulesStrings.li: subject->Wraith cloning pod
subject->biotank harmonic tuning
subject->enzyme-pulse stabilization
subject_adj->ZPM-assisted
subject_adj->phase-adaptive
subject_adj->quietly horrifying
subject_story->a Wraith growth chamber guided by Ancient field math
subject_story->a pod that no longer screams for power in fits and bursts
subject_story->a biotank whose heartbeat syncs to subspace harmonics
subject_gerund->stabilizing growth-cycle power flux
subject_gerund->modulating imprint heaters with ZPM carrier noise
subject_gerund->teaching a Wraith biotank to sip instead of devour

ResearchProjectDef.discoveredLetterText:
Your team has successfully applied ZPM-inspired power-shaping techniques to Wraith biotank architecture. The cloning pod now draws power in smooth subspace harmonics rather than violent spikes, reducing its overall energy consumption.

More importantly, this research has exposed deeper inefficiencies in the cloning process itself. By stabilizing biomass during imprint initiation and synchronizing growth cycles through controlled resonance, new auxiliary bio-devices can now be constructed to enhance cloning operations.

The pod remains quietly horrifying.

It is simply more disciplined now.
